results.content: Great course on Angular and a good overview. I wish that there was an extra module on Yeoman to explain all of the things it provides and your alternatives to it. It feels like there was a lot of sleight of hand involved there and I'm not confident on how I can integrate Angular with my existing apps because so much of the foundation was done automatically by Yeoman.
results.content_html: Great course on Angular and a good overview. I wish that there was an extra module on Yeoman to explain all of the things it provides and your alternatives to it. It feels like there was a lot of sleight of hand involved there and I'm not confident on how I can integrate Angular with my existing apps because so much of the foundation was done automatically by Yeoman.

results.content:
Do not take this course unless you're a seasoned JavaScript programmer!
The course code fails to work with current libraries and is therefore not  useful any more unless the Author steps up and corrects the code, at least in the comments/documentation.
Also, the material and content is badly communicated, and most of the coding and technique used is not properly explained. The tutor talks from the perspective of an expert, not from the perspective of someone who just starts with Angular JS.
Then there are no exercises or tests between the lectures or at least between the sections so how do you know whether you understood the concepts? Simply copying the coding does not make you a good programmer.
The biggest problem, however is, that there is no feedback any more from the author of the course! Any question you have, good luck in finding an answer!
